Antonio: At the moment I can not go on.
This PHP code reads $ _POST ['data'].
Only the format is not quite right. Instead of + an empty space is transferred.

The mod harbour program cuts off the text.
The format would fit.
PHP code

#define FILELOG   AP_GETENV( 'DOCUMENT_ROOT' ) + AP_GETENV( 'PATH_APP' ) + '/modharbour_samples/text/document.txt'



function Main()
   local hPairs := AP_PostPairs()
   local cText := ""
   ? "--before decode--------------------"
   ? VALTYP(hPairs)

   if Len( hPairs ) == 0
      ? "This example is used from samples/post.prg"
   else
      if hb_HHasKey( hPairs, "data" )
         cText = hPairs[ "data" ]
      endif
      ? cText
      memowrit( FILELOG, cText )

   endif

return nil

I have GitHub Desktop installed. I also cloned mod harbor  and inserted in the local version of my folder "Text" with the development status.

How does it go from here.
where do I find AP_postPairs. Should this work like PHP  $_POST['data']; -

hello antonio. Many thanks. I have now in my source code
 "application / octet-stream" changed - but  I do not receive any  data.
Yesterday, as a workaround, I added these lines to my code:


  cText: = STRTRAN (MemoRead (FILELOG + "document.txt"), CHR (34), "'")
  nAt: = At ​​("<img", cText)

  if nAt> 0
    cTxtNew: = left (cText, nAt -1)
    cTmpText: = SubStr (cText, nAt)
    //? cTmpText
    nAt2: = At ​​(">", cTmpText)

    if nAt2> 0
      cImage: = left (cTmpText, nAt2-1)
      cImage: = StrTran (cImage, "", "+")
      cImage: = "<img src =" + SubStr (cImage, 10)

    endif

    cTxtNew + = cImage
  endif

  cTxtNew + = substr (cTmpText, nAt2)

  cText: = cTxtNew

The images are displayed.
But the program is a mishmash.
mod harbor - call of php save.prg and then open with a selfmade converting function. It seems to me that saving with php is slow much slower than memowrit().

I will to stop here and try again some month later when I do understand more.
Use mod_harbour upload.prg
don't use save.php
upload.prg does the same work as php but you are in control
